meanings.definition: The soft, moist, shapeless mass of matter.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally spilled the juice, creating sticky pulps on the table.
meanings.sent2: The orange pulps were left behind after she finished her drink.
meanings.sent3: The toddler giggled as he squished the pulps of playdough in his hands.
meanings.sent4: The pulps of the overripe fruit oozed out when she squeezed it.
meanings.sent5: The pulps of the wet paper stuck to her fingers as she tried to clean up the spill.

meanings.definition: To reduce (food) to a soft, wet, shapeless mass.
meanings.sent1: She pulps the fruits to make a delicious smoothie every morning.
meanings.sent2: The blender quickly pulps the ingredients into a fine puree.
meanings.sent3: He pulps the bread in water to make a paste for the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The chef pulps the tomatoes to create a base for the sauce.
meanings.sent5: The machine pulps the wood into tiny fibers for paper production.

meanings.definition: A type of popular fiction published in the early to mid-20th century, characterized by lurid subject matter and often featuring detective stories or science fiction.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed reading the thrilling pulps from the 1950s.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore had a section dedicated to vintage pulps.
meanings.sent3: The pulps she found in the attic were filled with exciting mysteries.
meanings.sent4: His collection of pulps included rare editions of classic detective stories.
meanings.sent5: The pulps transported her to a world of suspense and intrigue.
